LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchogenInjector.label: ruined archogen injector
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchogenInjector.description: Once a functioning archite injection pod, its chamber and internal systems are completely destroyed. Nothing remains but twisted scrap metal.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedNeurostabilizerArray.label: ruined neurostabilizer array
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedNeurostabilizerArray.descript: This stabilizer module once calmed volatile archite reactions, but now its coils and casing are shattered. Only warped scraps are left.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedCognitiveRecoveryArray.label: ruined cognitive recovery array
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedCognitiveRecoveryArray.descri: Once used to ease recovery after injections, its circuitry is burned out and the frame is collapsing. All that remains is bent metal and debris.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedRapidInfusionPump.label: ruined rapid infusion pump
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedRapidInfusionPump.description: The infusion pump’s conduits are ruptured and its inner mechanisms destroyed. Only twisted scrap can be collected from it.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchiteRecycler.label: ruined archite recycler
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchiteRecycler.description: Previously a device for reclaiming unused archite capsules, it is now crushed beyond recognition. Nothing useful remains besides twisted metal.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedGenomicAttenuator.label: ruined genomic attenuator
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedGenomicAttenuator.description: The attenuator’s panels are torn open and its internals melted. Only broken, worthless scrap is left behind.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedRejectionBufferCoil.label: ruined rejection buffer coil
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedRejectionBufferCoil.descripti: Once a shielding coil, it is now bent, split, and entirely inert. Only scraps of twisted metal remain.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedSpliceframeUplink.label: ruined spliceframe uplink
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedSpliceframeUplink.description: This uplink console has collapsed into a pile of crushed arrays and dead wiring. Only jagged scrap can be recovered.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedMutagenInhibitorCore.label: ruined mutagen inhibitor core
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedMutagenInhibitorCore.descript: A massive suppression engine reduced to buckled plating and destroyed conduits. Nothing remains but heavy twisted scrap.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedTraitSelectionPrism.label: ruined trait selection prism
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedTraitSelectionPrism.descripti: The crystal housing is shattered and the prism array completely destroyed. Only splintered debris and warped scrap remain.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedAberrationRedirector.label: ruined aberration redirector
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedAberrationRedirector.descript: Once a mutation-control device, now a heap of caved-in panels and ruined internal channels. Only useless scrap is left.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedComplexityHarmonizer.label: ruined complexity harmonizer
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedComplexityHarmonizer.descript: The harmonizer’s cores have collapsed and its chassis is split wide open. Nothing survives except twisted metal fragments.
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchitePathingArray.label: ruined archite pathing array
LanguageData.VQEA_RuinedArchitePathingArray.descripti: This routing array is now a crushed frame with its circuitry burned out. Only warped scrap can be taken from it.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientFauxPlant.label: ancient faux plant
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientFauxPlant.description: A fake decorative plant used to brighten sterile rooms. It’s covered in dust but still adds a bit of color.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalArmchair.label: ancient hospital armchair
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalArmchair.description: A comfortable chair used in old hospital waiting rooms. The padding is worn but surprisingly intact.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalBench.label: ancient hospital bench
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalBench.description: A simple bench used for patients or visitors. It’s old, sturdy, and oddly comfortable.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalCrib.label: ancient hospital crib
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientHospitalCrib.description: A small metal crib once used in the vault’s nursery ward. The frame is rusted and the bedding long decayed.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientIncubator.label: ancient incubator
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientIncubator.description: An ancient incubation unit used for medical research or premature infants. Its systems are dead, but the shell remains mostly intact.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientIVStand.label: ancient IV stand
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientIVStand.description: A simple stand with long-empty fluid bags still hanging from it. It once delivered medicine or nutrients to patients.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientKitchenette.label: ancient kitchenette
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientKitchenette.description: A compact cooking unit used by lab staff. The surfaces are corroded and the appliances no longer work.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientSink.label: ancient small sink
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientSink.description: A rust-stained sink once used for washing hands or instruments. Water no longer flows through its cracked pipes.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientMedicalPartition.label: ancient medical partition
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientMedicalPartition.description: A folding partition used to divide patient areas for privacy. Its fabric is torn and coated in dust.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientOfficeDesk.label: ancient office desk
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientOfficeDesk.description: A sturdy desk once belonging to a researcher or administrator. Old data slates and papers still clutter the surface.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientRepairBench.label: ancient repair desk
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientRepairBench.description: A heavy workbench used to maintain laboratory equipment. The tools are gone, but the grease stains remain.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientResearchCountertop.label: ancient research countertop
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientResearchCountertop.descripti: A long research table covered in scorched metal and broken instruments. It was used for genetic and chemical experiments.
LanguageData.VQEA_BustedControlPanel.label: busted control panel
LanguageData.VQEA_BustedControlPanel.description: A ruined wall console once connected to the vault’s systems. Sparks still flicker from its shattered screen.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientOfficePrinter.label: ancient office printer
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientOfficePrinter.description: A dusty old office printer. It hums quietly, though it’s unlikely to print anything useful anymore.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientTripWarning.label: trip warning sign
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientTripWarning.description: A faded caution sign warning of hazards ahead. It serves no real purpose now except decoration.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientStorageHeater.label: ancient storage heater
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientStorageHeater.description: A compact electric heater from the ancient labs. It warms the air to a comfortable level when powered.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientToyBox.label: ancient toy box
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientToyBox.description: A small toy chest from the nursery wing. It’s filled with broken dolls and faded blocks. Toy boxes can be used to play with babies, satisfying their need for play.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientVitalsMonitor.label: ancient vitals monitor
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientVitalsMonitor.description: A bedside monitor used to track patient health. Its display is now cracked and it’s broken beyond repair.
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientWaterCooler.label: ancient water cooler
LanguageData.VQEA_AncientWaterCooler.description: A dusty water dispenser used by ancient lab staff. It no longer functions but remains as a relic of everyday life.
LanguageData.VQEA_CreepyBabyToy.label: creepy baby toy
LanguageData.VQEA_CreepyBabyToy.description: A small, broken toy that once comforted children. Something makes it unsettling to look at. Baby decorations increase the rate at which babies fill their play need when an adult plays with them. Place these around your child play areas.
LanguageData.VQEA_LargeWoodenMilitaryCrate.label: rotten military crate
LanguageData.VQEA_LargeWoodenMilitaryCrate.descriptio: A decaying wooden crate once used for storing military supplies. It’s too rotten to contain anything now.
LanguageData.VQEA_WoodenMilitaryCrate.label: rotten military box
LanguageData.VQEA_WoodenMilitaryCrate.description: A small, rusted box that once held munitions or rations. Now it’s empty and falling apart.
LanguageData.VQEA_RubbishPile.label: trash bags
LanguageData.VQEA_RubbishPile.description: Piles of old plastic waste left from the laboratory staff. They smell foul.
LanguageData.VQEA_RustedWheeledTray.label: rusted wheeled tray
LanguageData.VQEA_RustedWheeledTray.description: A rusted metal tray once used for medical instruments. It squeaks when moved and is covered in grime.
LanguageData.VQEA_VaultTerminal.label: vault terminal
LanguageData.VQEA_VaultTerminal.description: An ancient computer terminal used to control vault systems. It’s inactive, but its screen still flickers faintly.
LanguageData.VQEA_VaultTerminalBank.label: vault terminal bank
LanguageData.VQEA_VaultTerminalBank.description: A row of old computer terminals used to monitor vault operations. Most are dark, but a few lights still blink faintly.
LanguageData.VQEA_WarpedMopBucket.label: warped mop bucket
LanguageData.VQEA_WarpedMopBucket.description: A melted mop bucket left behind by cleaning staff. The handle has fused to the rim, making it useless.
LanguageData.VQEA_RustedHospitalBed.label: rusted hospital bed
LanguageData.VQEA_RustedHospitalBed.description: An adjustable medical bed with cracked padding and rusted rails. It was once used for surgeries and recovery.
LanguageData.VQEA_WheeledBed.label: wheeled bed
LanguageData.VQEA_WheeledBed.description: A simple rolling hospital bed designed to move patients between rooms. The wheels squeal when pushed.
LanguageData.VQEA_EmptyContainment.label: empty containment
LanguageData.VQEA_EmptyContainment.description: An empty containment pod. Whatever was inside got out long ago.
